result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:49 PM Defendant Brandon Lee Bernsteen in court, in custody.  Attorney Anne Renc in court for Brandon Lee Bernsteen.  Attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin.

This was on a motion but parties have come to an agreement.
A filed amended information has been filed with the court.
Parties can move forward to arraignment. 

Count 1 was amended, and count 2 remains the same as stated on record. 
Court reviews the amended information.
Count 3 has been amended.

records.addlTxt: filed by Atty Anne Renc

3:31 PM Defendant Brandon Lee Bernsteen in court, in custody.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Robert Jambois appears on behalf of ADA Brian J Pfeil for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant appears without counsel.
ADA Jambois states that the public defender has not yet appointed counsel for the defendant.
Defendant states the he had been informed the he can have his preliminary examination and when he gets counsel he can then have another preliminary hearing.
Court informs the defendant of the procedure of handling a preliminary hearing in Portage County.
3:34 p.m.  Detective N Shulfer is sworn in.
Direct examination by ADA Jambois.
3:35 p.m.  Witness identifies the defendant.
BY THE COURT:
Court takes notice that the witness has identified the defendant.

ADA Jambois would ask that the court take judicial notice of Vilas County Case #18CF133.
BY THE COURT:
Court takes judicial notice of 18CF133.

3:40 p.m.  Defendant questions the witness.
3:45 p.m.  ADA  Jambois has no redirect.
Witness is excused.
ADA Jambois has no further questions or witnesses.
Defendant has no witnesses.
ADA Jambois gives his final argument.
Defendant gives his final argument.

BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Defendant asks if the court can hear a bond modification.
Defendant is informed that the Court will not take up a bond modification today.
Defendant is informed that he can file a motion to modify his bond.
Arraignment scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Arraignment on September 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Letter from the Defendant in re:  holding preliminary hearing before July 26, 2022

3:28 PM Defendant Brandon Lee Bernsteen appeared by video in custody from the Waupaca County jail.  Attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court questions the defendant. 
Defendant spoke with Atty Drury and she filed an update in counsel.  He wants to be present in the courtroom for the preliminary hearing.  States he is on a probation hold and is being revoked for a Possession of Narcotics charge.  

BY THE COURT:  Court will adjourn for a couple of weeks.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt:
2:10 PM Defendant Brandon Lee Bernsteen appeared by video, in custody at the Waupaca County Jail.  Attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant appears without counsel today.
Defendant asks that the complaint be read in.
Court questions the defendant as to what he is inquiring.
Defendant wishes to have the complaint read in so that he can argue probable cause.
Defendant wishes to proceed on his own and object to the probable cause in the complaint.

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.

Defendant wishes to make argument on the complaint and asks that the police reports not be allowed.
BY THE COURT:
Defendant's request is DENIED.

Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Defendant makes further argument with regards to the probable cause in the complaint.
ADA Pfeil responds to the request of the defendant.
Defendant makes additional comments with regards to the complaint.
Court informs the defendant that his issue is not relevant of the sufficiency of the complaint for today.
Defendant is informed that he will need to file the proper motions.
Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
Defendant is informed to consult with an attorney and get legal representation for himself.
Defendant states that he "fired" Atty Maxwell Bergner.
Defendant had asked that Atty Bergner withdraw.
Defendant waives his time limits for a preliminary hearing while he waits for another public defender to be appointed.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on July 5, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt:
9:06 AM Defendant Brandon Lee Bernsteen does not appear. Attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Brandon Lee Bernsteen. 
Court calls the case. 
Matter was set for a motion to withdraw.
Court questions Atty Pfeil regarding the defendant's non-appearance.
Court questions Atty Bergner regarding the defendant's options for Attorneys moving forward.
Atty Bergner states that a Suriano letter will be sent to the defendant, informing the defendant he does not have unlimited attorneys appointed by the public defender's office.

BY THE COURT:
Motion for withdrawal of counsel is granted.
Motion hearing on June 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Brandon Lee Bernsteen
Current: 1402 Royalton St, c/o Waupaca County Jail, Waupaca, WI 54981 United States  (Effective: 05-11-2022)
Prior: 4367 Trails End Rd, Rhinelander, WI 54501

2:08 PM Defendant Brandon Lee Bernsteen appeared by video, in custody at the Waupaca County Jail.  Attorney Kelly Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Taylor Soule appears on behalf of Atty Maxwell Bergner for Brandon Lee Bernsteen. 

Atty Soule informs the Court that Atty Bergner filed a motion to withdraw today.
Atty Soule states that the public defender's office is in the process of appointing new counsel for the defendant.
Defendant is informed that this case could be delayed for a time and he is informed that he is now allowed to pick his own counsel.
Defendant makes statements as to why he is requesting new counsel.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued. 
Court will adjourn

Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 6, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
